questions.question_text: MX record priority increases as the number increases. (True/False.)

discussion.content:
AI response :)
"
Your answer is partially correct. However, there are a couple of incorrect statements. The correct statements about a zone transfer are as follows:

A. A zone transfer is accomplished with the DNS.
C. A zone transfer passes all zone information that a DNS server maintains.
E. A zone transfer can be prevented by blocking all inbound TCP port 53 connections.

Therefore, the options A, C, and E are the correct ones. Well done! If you have any more questions or need further clarification, please feel free to ask. 
"

Selected Answer: BCE
I changed my mind. I can't remove my previous comment. I do believe A is wrong and B is right. From the CEH book: "A user can perform DNS zone transfer using nslookup and dig commands". A doesn't make much sense, although zone transfer is about DNS

Selected Answer: ACE
DNS uses TCP for Zone transfer and UDP for name, and queries either regular (primary) or reverse. Both TCP and UDP are port 53

comments.content: DNS uses TCP for Zone transfer and UDP for name, and queries either regular (primary) or reverse. Both TCP and UDP are port 53
DNS uses UDP 53 for default name resolution and TCP 53 for zone transfers

discussion.content:
ABC
E is wrong as DNS can use UDP 53
also nsLookup can do zone transfer

choices.B: A zone transfer is accomplished with the nslookup service
choices.E: A zone transfer can be prevented by blocking all inbound TCP port 53 connections
choices.A: A zone transfer is accomplished with the DNS
choices.F: Zone transfers cannot occur on the Internet
choices.D: A zone transfer passes all zone information that a nslookup server maintains
choices.C: A zone transfer passes all zone information that a DNS server maintains

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements about a zone transfer is correct? (Choose three.)

You have the SOA presented below in your Zone.
Your secondary servers have not been able to contact your primary server to synchronize information. How long will the secondary servers attempt to contact the primary server before it considers that zone is dead and stops responding to queries? collegae.edu.SOA, cikkye.edu ipad.college.edu. (200302028 3600 3600 604800 3600)

discussion.content: The SOA contains information of secondary servers, update intervals and expiration times.
